item.title: PlayerHandler.GetPlayerCounts with ; or without?
item.dc:creator: @adam2348 adam2348
item.description:
@adam2348 wrote:

it is supposed to have the ;
the next error u got is saying that in ur playerhandler.java file it can’t find the getplayercount(), so u need to either add that or make sure u spelled it right with the correct CaPs.

item.title: PlayerHandler.GetPlayerCounts with ; or without?
item.dc:creator: @Slivion Slivion
item.description:
@Slivion wrote:

public void writePlayers() { int players = PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount;

This might help,

Open up Client Java,
Find the Code you added,
Where it says,

public void writePlayers() { int players = PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount;
Change the ‘{’ to a ‘;’.
It should look like,

public void writePlayers(); int players = PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount;

I’m not sure about this, But try it.

Read full topic

item.title: PlayerHandler.GetPlayerCounts with ; or without?
item.dc:creator: @Emaziz Emaziz
item.description:
@Emaziz wrote:

Hello, stupid problem I got :S

//Playercount and server name at top of screen public void writePlayers() { int players = PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount; sendFrame126("@yel@Owner=@whi@Emaziz", 6570); sendFrame126(" @red@Players On - " + players, 6664); setInterfaceWalkable(6673);//6673 }[code] If I don't have the ; after [code]int players = PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount then the error is that ; is expected. If if IT after int players = PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount then this is the error: client.java:51: cannot find symbol symbol: variable getPlayerCount location: class PlayerHandler int players = PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount;

Anyone help please? :S[/code][/code][br][size=1]Posted on: February 12, 2007, 10:01:49 AM[/size][hr]Noone even reads?

Read full topic
